abstract: Attention is given to a microplasma discharge to initiate a hollow cathode discharge for such applications as plasma flow experiments, the electric propulsion of space vehicles, and as a replacement for filament cathodes in neutral beam injector ion sources. The technique results in a cathode that is easy to start, simple in design, and which does not require external RF exciters, inserts or heating elements. Future applications may include ion beam milling and ion implantation.
title: Hollow cathode startup using a microplasma discharge

organization.name: California Institute of Technology, Jet Propulsion Laboratory, Electric Propulsion and Advanced Concepts Group, Pasadena
